title: Business & Finance
text:
U.S. stocks fell in an erratic session, with the S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq losing 0.7%, 0.6% and 0.3%, respectively. U.S. crude oil settled 3.6% higher at $123.70.

---

Coca-Cola said it would suspend operations in Russia and PepsiCo said it was halting sales of its big soda brands there. McDonald's said it was temporarily closing its restaurants in the country.

---

Chinese nickel titan Tsingshan faces billions of dollars in trading losses after Russia's war in Ukraine set off an unprecedented rise in the price of the metal.

---

Tesla 's Musk asked a federal judge to scrap a settlement he reached with the SEC that required some of his tweets be preapproved.

---

Google said it reached a deal to buy cybersecurity company Mandiant for nearly $5.4 billion.

---

Apple unveiled a new iPhone SE with 5G capability and a deal to stream Major League Baseball games on Friday nights.

---

Visa and Mastercard are preparing to increase the fees that many large merchants pay when they accept consumers' credit cards.
